p: On March 17th there were about 13000 hospitalized people in Italy (7000 only in Lombardia, with 880 critical patients saturating the capacity of Intensive Care Units, ICU), and the number of infections – without the exceptional measures adopted – was expected to increase exponentially in one month, making it impossible to simultaneously find thousands and thousands additional beds in ICU across the country. Southern regions could perform worse than the others, due to the reduced number of doctors, nurses, and medical facilities [3].
